intro: Rogiera variiflora, commonly known as the variable-flowered rogeria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges and can vary in size. Rogiera variiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
